sub_topic: Calculation of latent heat of fusion of a substance
message_1: What is the amount of energy required to completely melt 250 grams of ice at 0°C and convert it into water at the same temperature, given that the latent heat of fusion of water is 334 J/g?
message_2:
To calculate the amount of energy required to melt the ice and convert it into water at the same temperature, we can use the formula:

Energy (Q) = mass (m) × latent heat of fusion (Lf)

where
mass (m) = 250 grams
latent heat of fusion (Lf) = 334 J/g

Now, plug in the values:

Q = 250 g × 334 J/g

Q = 83,500 J

So, the amount of energy required to completely melt 250 grams of ice at 0°C and convert it into water at the same temperature is 83,500 Joules.
